meanings.definition: To sleep longer or better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always manages to outsleep her sister on weekends.
meanings.sent2: I tend to outsleep my alarm clock on lazy mornings.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to outsleep the dog to get the sunny spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: His ability to outsleep everyone else in the house was legendary.
meanings.sent5: I wish I could outsleep my worries and wake up refreshed.

meanings.sent1: The bear can outsleep any other animal in the forest.
meanings.sent2: I always manage to outsleep my friends during sleepovers.
meanings.sent3: The competition was fierce, but he managed to outsleep all his opponents.
meanings.sent4: She could outsleep even the deepest sleeper in the house.
meanings.sent5: The baby seemed to outsleep everyone in the household with her naps.
